description: '''Faust''' ({{IPA|de|faʊ̯st|lang}}, English: "fist") are a German rock band from Hamburg. Formed in 1971 by producer and former [[music journalist]] [[Uwe Nettelbeck]], the group was originally composed of [[Werner "Zappi" Diermaier]] (b.1949), Hans Joachim Irmler (b.1950), Arnulf Meifert, Jean-Hervé Péron (b.1949), Rudolf Sosna (1946 – 1996) and Gunther Wüsthoff, working with [[audio engineering|engineer]] Kurt Graupner. Their work was oriented around dissonance, [[improvisation]], and experimental [[electronic music|electronic]] approaches, and would influence subsequent [[ambient music|ambient]] and [[industrial music]]. They are considered a central act of [[West Germany]]'s 1970s [[krautrock]] movement.
